item.title: D.C. lobbyists battle over future of the Orthodox Church in Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Catherine Belton, David Stern
item.description: Critics say Kyiv is attacking religious freedom in its efforts to break the Ukrainian Orthodox Church’s ties with Moscow. Ukraine says it’s acting in self-defense.

item.title: Germany’s firewall against the far right isn’t working
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Recent elections in Germany show the limits of the nation’s statist efforts to stamp out far-right extremism and ultranationalism.

item.title: Super Typhoon Yagi, one of 2024’s most powerful storms, heads toward China
item.dc:creator: Vic Chiang, Matthew Cappucci
item.description: Packing winds of at least 150 mph, Yagi is the planet’s second-strongest storm this year. It is expected to hit the southern Chinese provinces of Hainan and Guangdong.

item.title: Blinken visits Haiti in show of U.S. support for struggling government
item.dc:creator: Michael Birnbaum, Widlore Mérancourt
item.description: Blinken’s trip to Haiti was a gamble for the Biden administration, calling attention to an unresolved crisis that, if mismanaged, could cause a migration surge.

item.title: Rome floats plan to charge tourists at Trevi Fountain
item.dc:creator: Natalie Compton
item.description: Italy’s most famous fountain has an overtourism problem, but locals say restricting access might not be the best solution.

item.title: How other countries have responded to gun violence, attacks at schools
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan, Bryan Pietsch
item.description: International responses to school shootings and gun violence vary widely, with some countries enacting strict laws.

item.title: Venezuela detains U.S. sailor, officials say
item.dc:creator: Alex Horton, Samantha Schmidt
item.description: The incident occurred amid an increasingly adversarial relationship between Washington and Caracas.

item.title: Nicaragua frees 135 political prisoners after secret U.S. negotiations
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan, Missy Ryan
item.description: Among those released are 13 members of a Texas-based evangelical organization. The prisoners were flown to Guatemala and can apply for U.S. residency.

item.title: The Philadelphi Corridor, an Israel-Gaza cease-fire obstacle, explained
item.dc:creator: Claire Parker, Sammy Westfall
item.description: Israel’s demand to control the Philadelphi Corridor — a narrow strip of no man’s land — is a key issue in Gaza cease-fire talks.

item.title: France’s Macron picks Michel Barnier as prime minister to end deadlock
item.dc:creator: Ellen Francis, Annabelle Timsit
item.description: The French president named Michel Barnier, the European Union’s former Brexit negotiator, nearly two months after elections that kept the far right from power but resulted in political deadlock.

item.title: Futebol-crazed Brazil is falling for another kind of football
item.dc:creator: Terrence McCoy
item.description: How the NFL, ESPN and Gisele Bündchen made Brazil the league’s largest market outside North America.

item.title: German police fatally shoot gunman near Israeli Consulate in Munich
item.dc:creator: Kate Brady
item.description: The attacker fired several shots near the consulate and was killed by police. The incident occurred on the anniversary of the 1972 Munich Olympics massacre.

item.title: Ukraine taps former ambassador Andrii Sybiha as top diplomat
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady
item.description: The replacement of prominent Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba comes amid a wide-ranging government reshuffle ahead of the president’s trip to the United States.

item.title: Woman testifies husband drugged her for years, recruited dozens to rape her
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit
item.description: The alleged victim told a court in Avignon, France, that her husband and the 51 other men accused in the case of raping her while she was unconscious destroyed her identity.

item.title: Russia dismisses charges of election meddling; Putin claims he backs Harris
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon, Catherine Belton
item.description: Despite calling the U.S. charges of interference nonsense, Russian officials have publicly celebrated attempts to influence the American public.

item.title: War within a war: Israel takes aim at Hamas militants in Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Susannah George, Suzan Haidamous
item.description: Officials and experts in Lebanon say Israel’s assassination campaign against Palestinian militants has brought Hamas and Hezbollah closer together.

item.title: Ugandan Olympic runner dies after being set on fire by ex-boyfriend
item.dc:creator: Katharine Houreld, Rael Ombuor
item.description: Rebecca Cheptegei is the third high-profile athlete to be killed in a domestic violence incident in Kenya.

item.title: New Zealand’s Maori celebrate new era as 27-year-old queen is anointed
item.dc:creator: Michael E. Miller
item.description: Nga Wai Hono i te Po Paki takes on the ceremonial role amid heightened tensions with the conservative government, which is rolling back “race-based” policies.

item.title: A tax on tourism? To visit these destinations, it’ll cost you extra.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett
item.description: New Zealand announced it is nearly tripling its tourist tax, joining places from Venice to Bali, Indonesia, that are trying to offset overtourism.

item.title: China pledges $50B and 1M jobs in renewed outreach to Africa
item.dc:creator: Christian Shepherd, Vic Chiang
item.description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping, seeking contrast with Washington, said Beijing offered Africa modernization without Western-style “suffering.”

item.title: Hostage killings and irreconcilable demands complicate cease-fire talks
item.dc:creator: Karen DeYoung
item.description: Frustrated mediators are now putting together what they have described as a “final offer,” but significant concessions on both sides are needed for agreement, said a U.S. official.

item.title: Netanyahu’s conflicting messages confuse cease-fire talks, officials say
item.dc:creator: Claire Parker, Loveday Morris, John Hudson
item.description: Netanyahu this week said Israel would not withdraw from the Gaza-Egypt border, while his chief negotiator told mediators the military would eventually pull out.

item.title: Breakdancer Raygun responds to backlash after infamous Olympic performance
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Edwards
item.description: The Australian academic said she has struggled with her mental health and worried about her and her loved ones’ safety, but that dancing remains her “medicine.”

item.title: All 72 deaths in U.K.’s Grenfell Tower fire avoidable, final report says
item.dc:creator: Karla Adam
item.description: The burning of Grenfell Tower and the deaths of dozens horrified Britain and put renewed scrutiny on building codes and safety measures.

item.title: Zelensky reshuffles cabinet at key moment in war and ahead of U.S. trip
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady, Serhii Korolchuk
item.description: The reorganization of the administration comes as Russia unleashes a new wave of aerial attacks on Ukrainian cities, including one on Lviv that killed seven overnight.

item.title: Why everyone is suddenly worried about Mexico’s democracy
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan
item.description: President Andres Manuel López Obrador, in his final month in office, is pushing legislation that would send appointed federal judges home and let voters elect their replacements.

item.title: Spanish singles found a new dating strategy. It’s in the fruit aisle.
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands
item.description: The method, which grew popular on TikTok, involves placing a pineapple in your cart at the Mercadona grocery store at night. People say it’s a reaction against dating apps.

item.title: Which countries have suspended or restricted arms sales to Israel?
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Leo Sands
item.description: The U.K. is the latest country to suspend some weapons exports, amid scrutiny over military aid to Israel as the war in Gaza nears the one-year mark.
